details.message: Host the font locally with https://github.com/neverpanic/google-font-download or https://google-webfonts-helper.herokuapp.com/

technologies.name: Drupal
technologies.description: Drupal is a free and open-source web content management framework.

technologies.name: PHP
technologies.description: PHP is a general-purpose scripting language used for web development.

technologies.name: Firebase
technologies.description: Firebase is a Google-backed application development software that enables developers to develop iOS, Android and Web apps.

technologies.name: Leaflet
technologies.description: Leaflet is the open-source JavaScript library for mobile-friendly interactive maps.

technologies.name: Plyr
technologies.description: Plyr is a simple, lightweight, accessible and customizable HTML5, YouTube and Vimeo media player that supports modern browsers.

technologies.name: Bootstrap
technologies.description: Bootstrap is a free and open-source CSS framework directed at responsive, mobile-first front-end web development. It contains CSS and JavaScript-based design templates for typography, forms, buttons, navigation, and other interface components.

technologies.name: GSAP
technologies.description: GSAP is an animation library that allows you to create animations with JavaScript.

technologies.name: Nginx
technologies.description: Nginx is a web server that can also be used as a reverse proxy, load balancer, mail proxy and HTTP cache.

technologies.name: Drupal Multisite
technologies.description: Drupal Multisite enables separate, independent sites to be served from a single codebase.

technologies.name: jsDelivr
technologies.description: JSDelivr is a free public CDN for open-source projects. It can serve web files directly from the npm registry and GitHub repositories without any configuration.

technologies.name: New Relic
technologies.description: New Relic is a SaaS offering that focuses on performance and availability monitoring.

technologies.name: Matomo Analytics
technologies.description: Matomo Analytics is a free and open-source web analytics application, that runs on a PHP/MySQL web-server.

technologies.name: Livefyre
technologies.description: Livefyre is a platform that integrates with the social web to boost social interaction.

technologies.name: LazySizes
technologies.description: LazySizes is a JavaScript library used to delay the loading of images (iframes, scripts, etc) until they come into view.

technologies.name: jQuery
technologies.description: jQuery is a JavaScript library which is a free, open-source software designed to simplify HTML DOM tree traversal and manipulation, as well as event handling, CSS animation, and Ajax.

technologies.name: core-js
technologies.description: core-js is a modular standard library for JavaScript, with polyfills for cutting-edge ECMAScript features.

technologies.name: reCAPTCHA
technologies.description: reCAPTCHA is a free service from Google that helps protect websites from spam and abuse.

technologies.name: HSTS
technologies.description: HTTP Strict Transport Security (HSTS) informs browsers that the site should only be accessed using HTTPS.

technologies.name: Webpack
technologies.description: Webpack is an open-source JavaScript module bundler.

technologies.name: Module Federation
technologies.description: Module Federation is a webpack technology for dynamically loading parts of other independently deployed builds.

technologies.name: Babel
technologies.description: Babel is a free and open-source transcompiler for writing next generation JavaScript.

runWarnings: The page may not be loading as expected because your test URL (https://citedecarcassonne.culture.gouv.fr/) was redirected to https://citedecarcassonne.culture.gouv.fr/fr. Try testing the second URL directly.

accessibility.title: Accessibility
accessibility.description: These checks highlight opportunities to [improve the accessibility of your web app](https://developers.google.com/web/fundamentals/accessibility). Only a subset of accessibility issues can be automatically detected so manual testing is also encouraged.
accessibility.manualDescription: These items address areas which an automated testing tool cannot cover. Learn more in our guide on [conducting an accessibility review](https://developers.google.com/web/fundamentals/accessibility/how-to-review).

seo.title: SEO
seo.description: These checks ensure that your page is following basic search engine optimization advice. There are many additional factors Lighthouse does not score here that may affect your search ranking, including performance on [Core Web Vitals](https://web.dev/learn-web-vitals/). [Learn more](https://support.google.com/webmasters/answer/35769).
seo.manualDescription: Run these additional validators on your site to check additional SEO best practices.

pwa.title: PWA
pwa.description: These checks validate the aspects of a Progressive Web App. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/progressive-web-apps/checklist).
pwa.manualDescription: These checks are required by the baseline [PWA Checklist](https://developers.google.com/web/progressive-web-apps/checklist) but are not automatically checked by Lighthouse. They do not affect your score but it's important that you verify them manually.
